author: Louis Milman
title: University of Florida Football Player Arrested on Aggravated Assault Charge
text:
Share Article 
Photo by Rob Foldy/Getty Images (GAINESVILLE, Fla.) -- University of Florida freshman football player Deiondre Porter was suspended from the team indefinitely after being arrested Wednesday for aggravated assault with a weapon.The official Twitter account for the university's football team announced Porter's suspension Wednesday, hours after the Gainesville Police Department released an arrest report. The report said that Porter had confronted a female victim about her being involved with one of his teammates. 
— Gators Football (@GatorsFB) October 14, 2015 
When the girl "retreated to her bedroom to avoid the confrontation," police say Porter followed her, armed with a handgun, and placed it against her head demanding she tell him the truth. The victim told police she made multiple attempts to contact the teammate to prove that she had not been involved with him, but got no answer.The argument resumed later that morning, with Porter demanding the truth and eventually firing the handgun in the direction of the victim. The police report says that Porter and the victim had dated since 2013 and that the victim is ten weeks pregnant.The incident occurred on Sept. 29, and the following day, police contacted Porter while he was the passenger in a vehicle. The driver of that vehicle was arrested for possession of drugs and a concealed firearm. 

Deiondre Porter was also in a vehicle on Sept 30th where the driver was arrested for drugs and concealed firearm: https://t.co/eqyVqeQFLw — Gainesville Police (@GainesvillePD) October 14, 2015 
Porter was arrested Wednesday and faces weapons and criminal mischief charges in addition to the aggravated assault charge.
